message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.RO 

The paper deals with learning transformation operators on high dimensional datasets, specifically natural image patches and video sequences. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper introduces a penalty on traversed manifold distance, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG) to encourage sparsity and reduce overfitting. The use of a smoothing operator to escape local minima also suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also deals with parameter estimation and training a linear transformation model, which are common topics in neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper deals with Lie groups, which are commonly used in robotics (cs.RO) for modeling the motion of rigid bodies.
